articles.author: CBC News
articles.title: The next generation: 5 Canadian sprinters to watch at Paris Olympics and beyond | CBC Sports
articles.description: Behind great Andre De Grasse, there's a new generation of sprinting talent heading to Paris, ready to show Canada what they've got. With athletics set begin on Thursday, Aug. 1, here are five up-and-coming sprinters to watch in Paris and beyond.
articles.content:
For the last decade, Andre De Grasse has been the face of Canadian track.
Going into the Paris Olympics, De Grasse one of two athletes chosen to carry Canada's flag at the opening ceremony has six O… [+7311 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: U.S. men's gymnastics wins first Olympic medal since 2008
articles.description: The U.S. men's gymnastics team won bronze in the Paris Olympics team event on Monday. It was the first time the team has medaled since the 2008 games in Beijing. "CBS Saturday Morning" co-host and CBS News and sports correspondent Dana Jacobson joins from Par…

articles.author: Robby Berman
articles.title: Playing contact sports could raise risk of Parkinson’s-like movement disorder
articles.description: A new study found that athletes who developed chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE) from playing contact sports have a high risk of Parkinsonism, a movement disorder similar to Parkinson's disease. CTE is a brain disorder often caused by repeated head injuri…
articles.content:
• Playing contact sports is linked to the development of chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE), a brain disorder often caused by repeated head injuries.
